/** * Get the index of a unit cell to which the query point belongs. * *

For instance, all points in the unit cell at the origin will return (0,0,0); * Points in the unit cell one unit further along the `a` axis will return (1,0,0), * etc. * @param pt Input point (in orthonormal coordinates) * @return A new point with the three indices of the cell containing pt */
